intro: Cyphostemma orondo, commonly known as the Orondo moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in semi-arid to arid conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
